title: Why do people complain about their rank when they're just bad?
body: I'm not even trying and I have a 90% win rate and it honestly feels like im playing against beginner bots.

replies.body: let me find you a cookie
I don't get the point of this post...am I missing something?

If you win 90% you are simply not at your correct rank yet, wait until you get to your correct rank and it will drop to 50%.

Edit: I just check you only have 20 games played and most with op Sona so it doesnt mean much until you have at least 50-100 games.
It is not enough to be not bad for your rank to go up, you need to be good or better. Otherwise you stay at where you at.
actually if you don't feed you will easily climb up ranks

Maybe works if you are like plat 5 and you want to go to plat 3, after that you also have to contribute something to your team other than to sit under tower have 3 cs/min and not feed.

Eventually your team cant carry a 4.5 vs 5 when everyone is equally skilled. Especially if you take up an important role like MID or ADC.

> [{quoted}](name=bywords70,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=ptmI5VTW,comment-id=00040000,timestamp=2017-11-24T08:31:52.689+0000)
>
> actually if you don't feed you will easily climb up ranks

not at all I used to lose with 4-7 KDA, but still lose.  The reason why you need to be good or better is you need to **carry** the game. Otherwise, you are in hands of your teammates (with your contribution as well) and enemy lack of skill.
Because anytime you start climbing up a tiny bit you get matched with a 0/20/0 Support Yasuo, and everybody acts like it's your job to carry that.

because self responsibility isn't a thing.

Everyone is secretly challenger LCS tier that can easily 1v1 faker and everyone else is just holding them back.
No one complain about ranks. We complain about players.
